FuncDef:
The acl command configures an ACL for the gRPC IPv4 service during Telemetry dynamic subscription.
The undo acl command deletes an ACL of the gRPC IPv4 service during Telemetry dynamic subscription.
By default, no ACL is configured for the gRPC IPv4 service during Telemetry dynamic subscription.

ParaDef.Info:
Creates a named ACL.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The name must start with a letter or digit, and cannot contain only digits.

Creates a basic or numbered advanced ACL.
The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 3999.
The number of a basic ACL ranges from 2000 to 2999.The number of an advanced ACL ranges from 3000 to 3999.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a collector functioning as a client initiates a connection to a device functioning as a server, the data sampled is dynamically subscribed to. In this case, you can run the acl command to configure an ACL for the gRPC IPv4 service. This allows certain clients to connect to the server.
Prerequisites
An ACL has been created.
